//notes: while the model is clearly made to fit a particular model of a pistol, we model its permissiveness more loosely based on the photos from source
description: A leather holster, originally designed for revolvers of around 5″ of barrel length, but able to hold an automatic pistol as well.  Straps onto a belt; usually a leather belt is preferred, for practical or aesthetic reasons.
//weight: estimated as (area of holster × 3) × leather thickness per sq.ft.
(holster height [7 in.] × holster width [4.5 in.] × (1 - 0.25)) × 3 × leather thickness [8 oz / sq.ft.] = 3.9375 oz = 111.63 g ≈ 112 g
area of holster adjusted by 25% as per dimensions calculation

//max_item_length: length of Colt Single Action Army with a 5.5-in. barrel
reference revolver based on photos from source

description: A thick leather sheath for a hunting knife made by Evil Duck Studios.  Worn horizontally on a belt; usually a leather belt is preferred, for practical or aesthetic reasons.
//weight: estimated as (area of sheath × 3) × leather thickness per sq.ft.
(sheath length [6.15 in.] × sheath height [2.15 in.] × (1 - 0.05)) × 3 × leather thickness [8 oz / sq.ft.] * 1.075 = 2.251 oz = 63.8 g
area of holster adjusted by 5%, and overall weight adjusted by 7.5%, as per dimensions calculation

notes: dimensions acquired relative to those of the Buck 119 hunting knife (used as basis for hunting knife in Core audit)
length is 102.5% of length of blade
width is 90% of width of guard
height is height of guard (almost exactly)
first trim is to account for the difference between bounding box and the item
second trim is to account for the thin strap under the handle, for hanging the sheath onto a belt

//longest_side: 10.55 in. (overall length of hunting knife) × 80% = 8.44 in. = 214.38 mm

pocket_data.//max_contains_weight: weight of hunting knife (213 g) rounded to the nearest 5/10 g
//max_contains_volume: volume of hunting knife (95 ml), rounded to the nearest 5/10 ml

description: A thin Kydex sheath for a large kukri.  Comes with a leather loop for hanging the sheath off the belt.
//volume: calculated as dimensions of kukri blade (23.48 ml, audited in Core) × 107.5%
//longest_side: length of kukri blade (375 mm, audited in Core) × 107.5%

//max_contains_volume: volume of hunting knife (95 ml), rounded to the nearest 5/10 ml

description: A holster for pistols of up to 5″ of barrel length.  This model features a small cutout for pistols using compact red dot sights.  It can be worn on the belt or attached to a MOLLE-capable vest or rig.

pocket_data.//max_contains_weight: weight of a loaded M9 (2.55 lbs = 1156.7 g) + 50 g
//max_contains_volume: added 50 ml to account for red dot sights
red dot sight volume based on Loadout models

//flags: replaced BELTED and OVERSIZE with CANT_WEAR

//notes: while the original sheathe was designed to only ever take knives, this models seems perfectly capable of holding other thin and long items
description: A nylon sheath designed for holding knives and other small blades.  Has straps for attaching to PALS webbing, to be used on a belt or a plate carrier.  Activate to sheathe/draw the holstered item.
//weight: using 1.15 g/ml as typical density of nylon

//max_contains_volume: from dimensions of a kirpan (audited in Core), which should realistically fit into a sheath like that
pocket_data.//max_item_length: 14 in. maximum length of an item, since the sheath itself does not reach to the very bottom edge of the backer

description: A small strip of nylon, intended to allow you to carry a pistol on your vest via PALS webbing.  Unlike most holsters, this one doesn't have restrictions on length, so you can -- at the detriment of the space available on your webbing -- use it to store a suppressed pistol with a compact red dot sight.  The pistol is held in place with a hook-and-loop middle strap, and secured by an elastic cord, but of which make taking the pistol out and putting it back in somewhat cumbersome.

//max_contains_weight: weight of a loaded M1911 (45.9 oz ≈ 1301 g)
and with a set of red dot sights (~50 g)
//max_contains_volume: plus volume of a ~6.5″ .45 ACP suppressor
plus 50 ml for possible red dot sights
red dot sight volume based on Loadout models
pocket_data.//max_item_length: overall length of M1911 (8.5 in. ≈ 216 mm) with a ~6.5″ suppressor (≈ 165 mm), plus 2.5%

//flags: replaced BELTED and OVERSIZE with CANT_WEAR
replaced PALS_SMALL with MOLLE_ATTACH and BELT_GEAR
